Subjects: religion, difficulty of choosing a profession in
_description: The difficulty of choosing a profession in religion — twenty-one8-line stanzas, with refrain, ‘Allas quid eligam ignoro’

CULHh412.First Lines:
Consideryng effectually the gret diuersiteOf sectys conteynyd in
                    the church present…
CULHh412.Last Lines:
…Than durst I be ryght bold thys refreyt for to precheAlas
                        Quid eligam ignore
CULHh412.Editions:
Person,  Henry Axel. 
             Cambridge Middle English Lyrics.
         Seattle: University of Washington Press, 1953; rev. ed. 1962: 44-8.

BLAdd29729.First Lines:
Considring effectuallyþe grete diversiteof sectes conteynyd in
                    the chirche present…
BLAdd29729.Last Lines:
…we shall trust in god in avoydyng this sentenceOf allas quid
                    eligam Ignoro
BLAdd29729.Attributed Title: Quid eligam ignoro (in upper margin by scribe, f. 3)
